de.mrapp.android.adapter

Interface ExpandableRecyclerViewAdapter

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Adapter<android.widget.ExpandableListView>, java.lang.Cloneable, DataStructure, ExpandableGridViewAdapter, Loggable, Parameterizable, Restorable, java.io.Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, MultipleChoiceExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, NoChoiceExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, SelectableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, SingleChoiceExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractEnableStateExpandableListAdapter, AbstractExpandableListAdapter, AbstractFilterableExpandableListAdapter, AbstractItemStateExpandableListAdapter, AbstractSelectableExpandableListAdapter, AbstractSortableExpandableListAdapter, ExpandableListAdapterImplementation, MultipleChoiceExpandableListAdapterImplementation, SingleChoiceExpandableListAdapterImplementation

    public interface ExpandableRecyclerViewAdapter
extends ExpandableGridViewAdapter
    Defines the interface, all expandable list adapters, which can be attached to a RecyclerView, must implement.
    Since:
    0.8.0
    Author:
    Michael Rapp

      static class  ExpandableRecyclerViewAdapter.ExpandableListItemViewHolder
      The view holder, which is used by a ExpandableRecyclerViewAdapter.

    • Method Detail

      • attach

        void attach(@NonNull
            androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView adapterView)
        Attaches the adapter to a view.
        Parameters:
        adapterView - The view, the adapter should be attached to, as an instance of the class RecyclerView. The view may not be null

      • notifyGroupChanged

        void notifyGroupChanged(int groupIndex)
        Notifies any registered observers that the group at groupIndex has changed. Equivalent to calling notifyGroupChanged(groupIndex, false, null);.

        This is a group change event, not a structural change event. It indicates that any reflection of the data at groupIndex is out of date and should be updated. The group at groupIndex retains the same identity.

        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group, which has been changed, as an Integer value
        See Also:
        notifyGroupRangeChanged(int, int)

      • notifyGroupChanged

        void notifyGroupChanged(int index,
                        java.lang.Object payload)
        Notifies any registered observers that the group at groupIndex has changed with an optional payload object.

        This is a group change event, not a structural change event. It indicates that any reflection of the data at groupIndex is out of date and should be updated. The group at groupIndex retains the same identity.

        Optionally, if the group is currently expanded, the registered observers can be notified that the children of the changed group have been changed as well. This is equivalent to calling the notifyChildRangeChanged-method for all children of the according group.

        The client can optionally pass a payload for partial change. These payloads will be merged and may be passed to the adapter's onBindViewHolder-method, if the group is already represented by a view holder and it will be rebound to the same view holder. Calling the notifyGroupRangeChanged-method with null payload will clear all existing payloads on that group and prevent future payload until the onBindViewHolder-method is called. Adapters should not assume that the payload will always be passed to the onBindViewHolder-method, e.g. when the view is not attached, the payload will be simply dropped.

        Parameters:
        index - The index of the group, which has been changed, as an Integer value
        payload - An optional payload as an instance of the class Object or null to identify a "full" update
        See Also:
        notifyGroupRangeChanged(int, int)

      • notifyGroupRangeChanged

        void notifyGroupRangeChanged(int startIndex,
                             int groupCount)
        Notifies any registered observers that the groupCount groups starting at startIndex have changed. Equivalent to calling notifyGroupRangeChanged(startIndex, groupCount, null);.

        This is a group change event, not a structural change event. It indicates that any reflection of the data in the given position range is out of date and should be updated. The groups in the given range retain the same identity.

        Parameters:
        startIndex - The index of the first group, which has been changed, as an Integer value
        groupCount - The number of groups, which have been changed, as an Integer value. The number of groups must be at least 1
        See Also:
        notifyGroupChanged(int)

      • notifyGroupRangeChanged

        void notifyGroupRangeChanged(int startIndex,
                             int groupCount,
                             java.lang.Object payload)
        Notifies any registered observers that the groupCount groups starting at startIndex have changed. An optional payload can be passed to each changed group.

        This is an group change event, not a structural change event. It indicates that any reflection of the data in the given position range is out of date and should be updated. The groups in the given range retain the same identity.

        The client can optionally pass a payload for partial change. These payloads will be merged and may be passed to the adapter's onBindViewHolder-method, if the group is already represented by a view holder and it will be rebound to the same view holder. Calling the notifyGroupRangeChanged-method with null payload will clear all existing payloads on that group and prevent future payload until the onBindViewHolder-method is called. Adapters should not assume that the payload will always be passed to the onBindViewHolder-method, e.g. when the view is not attached, the payload will be simply dropped.

        Parameters:
        startIndex - The index of the first group, which has been changed, as an Integer value
        groupCount - The number of groups, which have been changed, as an Integer value
        payload - An optional payload as an instance of the class Object or null to identify a "full" update
        See Also:
        notifyGroupChanged(int, Object)

      • notifyGroupInserted

        void notifyGroupInserted(int groupIndex)
        Notifies any registered observers that the group at groupIndex has been newly inserted. The group previously at groupIndex is now at groupIndex + 1.

        This is a structural change event. Representations of other existing groups in the data set are still considered up to date and will not be rebound, though their positions may be altered.

        If the group is currently expanded, the registered observers will implicitly be notified that the children of the group have been inserted as well. This is equivalent to calling the notifyChildRangeInserted-method for all children.

        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group, which has been inserted, as an Integer value
        See Also:
        notifyGroupRangeInserted(int, int)

      • notifyGroupRangeInserted

        void notifyGroupRangeInserted(int startIndex,
                              int groupCount)
        Notifies any registered observers that the currently reflected groupCount groups starting at startIndex have been newly inserted. The groups previously located at startIndex and beyond can now be found starting at startIndex + groupCount.

        This is a structural change event. Representations of other existing groups in the data set are still considered up to date and will not be rebound, though their positions may be altered.

        Parameters:
        startIndex - The index of the first group, which has been inserted, as an Integer value
        groupCount - The number of groups, which have been inserted, as an Integer value. The number of groups must at least 1
        See Also:
        notifyGroupInserted(int)

      • notifyGroupRemoved

        void notifyGroupRemoved(int groupIndex)
        Notifies any registered observers that the group previously located at groupIndex has been removed from the data set. The groups previously located at and after groupIndex may now be found at the oldIndex - 1.

        This is a structural change event. Representations of other existing groups in the data set are still considered up to date and will not be rebound, though their positions may be altered.

        If the group is currently expanded, the registered observers will implicitly be notified that the children of the group have been removed as well. This is equivalent to calling the notifyChildRangeRemoved-method for all children.

        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group, which has been removed, as an Integer value

      • notifyChildChanged

        void notifyChildChanged(int groupIndex,
                        int childIndex)
        Notifies any registered observers that the child at childIndex of the group at groupIndexhas changed. Equivalent to calling notifyChildChanged(groupIndex, childIndex, null);.

        This is a child change event, not a structural change event. It indicates that any reflection of the data at childIndex is out of date and should be updated. The child at childIndex retains the same identity.

        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group, the child, which has been changed, corresponds to, as an Integer value
        childIndex - The index of the child, which has been changed, as an Integer value
        See Also:
        notifyChildRangeChanged(int, int, int)

      • notifyChildChanged

        void notifyChildChanged(int groupIndex,
                        int childIndex,
                        java.lang.Object payload)
        Notifies any registered observers that the child at childIndex of the group at groupIndex has changed with an optional payload object.

        This is a child change event, not a structural change event. It indicates that any reflection of the data at childIndex is out of date and should be updated. The child at childIndex retains the same identity.

        The client can optionally pass a payload for partial change. These payloads will be merged and may be passed to the adapter's onBindViewHolder-method, if the child is already represented by a view holder and it will be rebound to the same view holder. Calling the notifyChildRangeChanged-method with null payload will clear all existing payloads on that child and prevent future payload until the onBindViewHolder-method is called. Adapters should not assume that the payload will always be passed to the onBindViewHolder-method, e.g. when the view is not attached, the payload will be simply dropped.

        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group, the child, which has been changed, corresponds to, as an Integer value
        childIndex - The index of the child, which has been changed, as an Integer value
        payload - An optional payload as an instance of the class Object or null to identify a "full" update
        See Also:
        notifyChildRangeChanged(int, int, int)

      • notifyChildRangeChanged

        void notifyChildRangeChanged(int groupIndex,
                             int startIndex,
                             int childCount)
        Notifies any registered observers that the childCount children starting at startIndex of the group at groupIndex have changed. Equivalent to calling notifyChildRangeChanged(groupInex, startIndex, childCount, null);.

        This is a child change event, not a structural change event. It indicates that any reflection of the data in the given position range is out of date and should be updated. The children in the given range retain the same identity.

        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group, the children, which have been changed, correspond to, as an Integer value
        startIndex - The index of the first child, which has been changed, as an Integer value
        childCount - The number of children, which have been changed, as an Integer value. The number of children must be at least 1
        See Also:
        notifyChildChanged(int, int)

      • notifyChildRangeChanged

        void notifyChildRangeChanged(int groupIndex,
                             int startIndex,
                             int childCount,
                             java.lang.Object payload)
        Notifies any registered observers that the childCount children starting at startIndex of the group at groupIndex have changed. An optional payload can be passed to each changed child.

        This is a child change event, not a structural change event. It indicates that any reflection of the data in the given position range is out of date and should be updated. The children in the given range retain the same identity.

        The client can optionally pass a payload for partial change. These payloads will be merged and may be passed to the adapter's onBindViewHolder-method, if the child is already represented by a view holder and it will be rebound to the same view holder. Calling the notifyChildRangeChanged-method with null payload will clear all existing payloads on that group and prevent future payload until the onBindViewHolder-method is called. Adapters should not assume that the payload will always be passed to the onBindViewHolder-method, e.g. when the view is not attached, the payload will be simply dropped.

        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group, the children, which have been changed, corresponds to, as an Integer value
        startIndex - The index of the first child, which has been changed, as an Integer value
        childCount - The number of children, which have been changed, as an Integer value
        payload - An optional payload as an instance of the class Object or null to identify a "full" update
        See Also:
        notifyChildChanged(int, int, Object)

      • notifyChildInserted

        void notifyChildInserted(int groupIndex,
                         int childIndex)
        Notifies any registered observers that the child at childIndex of the group at groupIndex has been newly inserted. The child previously at childIndex is now at childIndex + 1.

        This is a structural change event. Representations of other existing children in the data set are still considered up to date and will not be rebound, though their positions may be altered.

        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of hte group, the child, which has been inserted, corresponds to, as an Integer value
        childIndex - The index of the child, which has been inserted, as an Integer value
        See Also:
        notifyChildRangeInserted(int, int, int)

      • notifyChildRangeInserted

        void notifyChildRangeInserted(int groupIndex,
                              int startIndex,
                              int childCount)
        Notifies any registered observers that the currently reflected childCount children starting at startIndex of the group at groupIndex have been newly inserted. The children previously located at startIndex and beyond can now be found starting at startIndex + childCount.

        This is a structural change event. Representations of other existing children in the data set are still considered up to date and will not be rebound, though their positions may be altered.

        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of hte group, the child, which has been inserted, corresponds to, as an Integer value
        startIndex - The index of the first group, which has been inserted, as an Integer value
        childCount - The number of groups, which have been inserted, as an Integer value. The number of groups must at least 1
        See Also:
        notifyChildInserted(int, int)

      • notifyChildRemoved

        void notifyChildRemoved(int groupIndex,
                        int childIndex)
        Notifies any registered observers that the child previously located at childIndex of the group at groupIndex has been removed from the data set. The children previously located at and after childIndex may now be found at oldIndex - 1.

        This is a structural change event. Representations of other existing children in the data set are still considered up to date and will not be rebound, though their positions may be altered.

        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group, the child, which has been removed, corresponds to, as an Integer value
        childIndex - The index of the child, which has been removed, as an Integer value
        See Also:
        notifyChildRangeRemoved(int, int, int)

      • notifyChildRangeRemoved

        void notifyChildRangeRemoved(int groupIndex,
                             int startIndex,
                             int childCount)
        Notifies any registered observers that the childCount children previously located at startIndex of the group at groupIndex have been removed from the data set. The children previously located at and after startIndex + childCount may now be found at oldIndex - childCount.

        This is a structural change event. Representations of other existing children in the data set are still considered up to date and will not be rebound, though their positions may be altered.

        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group, the children, which have been removed, correspond to, as an Integer value
        startIndex - The previous index of the first child, which has been removed, as an Integer value
        childCount - The number of children, which have been removed, as an Integer value. The number of children must be at least 1
